annotation.summary: A character’s background represents their life before adventuring and grants additional abilities. While most backgrounds are common and available to all, some are uncommon or rare, offering unique benefits tied to distinctive origins.
annotation.prerequisites: Character creation; selection of a background (common, uncommon, or rare).

annotation.summary: At character creation, you select a permanent background that provides ability boosts, a skill feat, and trained proficiency in two skills (including one Lore skill). If a skill proficiency overlaps with one granted by your class, you may choose a different skill to become trained in instead.

Lore skills cover specialized knowledge areas. Players choose a specific topic for their Lore skill, subject to GM approval. The rulebook provides examples of common Lore categories, and skill feats can enhance these skills.
The character gains training in both the Crafting and Art Lore skills, and also receives the Specialty Crafting skill feat.
The character becomes trained in Athletics and Sports Lore, and gains the Deadlift skill feat.
The character gains training in the Survival skill and Underworld Lore, and also receives the Experienced Tracker skill feat.
The character gains training in Athletics and Sports Lore, and chooses either the Quick Jump or Titan Wrestler skill feat.
The feature grants training in the Deception skill and a Lore skill related to a specific settlement, along with the Face in the Crowd skill feat.
The character gains training in Deception and Underworld Lore, and also acquires the Without a Trace skill feat.
The character gains training in the Performance and Media Lore skills and acquires the Just Kidding skill feat.
The feature grants training in the Survival skill and Cooking Lore, and provides the Seasoned skill feat.
The character gains training in the Society skill and Corporate Lore, and receives the Management Material skill feat.
The character gains training in both the Crafting skill and the Augmentation Lore skill, and also acquires the Augmented Body feat.
The character becomes trained in both the Society and Underworld Lore skills and gains the Streetwise skill feat.
The feature grants training in Diplomacy and one Lore skill related to a chosen planet, along with the Group Impression skill feat.
The paragraph describes a character who is a devoted follower of a specific deity, having dedicated their life and skills to serving that divine power, whether through upbringing or personal calling.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a follower or devotee of a chosen deity.

annotation.summary: Grants training in the deity’s divine skill and a related Lore skill, and provides the Religious Talisman skill feat regardless of prerequisites.
annotation.prerequisites: None; feat granted even if normal prerequisites are not met.

annotation.summary: The character gains training in the Medicine skill and the Life Science Lore skill, and also acquires the Battle Medicine skill feat.
The feature grants training in the Occultism skill and one Lore skill related to a chosen metaphysical topic, along with the Schooled in Secrets skill feat.
The character gains training in both the Crafting skill and the Physical Science Lore skill, and also acquires the Electrical Engineer skill feat.
The character gains training in the Society skill and in a Lore skill tied to a familiar city or region, and also acquires the Multilingual skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified; typically chosen during character creation or background selection.

annotation.summary: The character becomes trained in Deception and Games Lore, and gains the Lie to Me skill feat.
The character gains training in Crafting and either Augmentation or Life Science Lore, and receives the Serum Crafting skill feat.
prerequisites: Trained in Augmentation Lore or Life Science Lore

annotation.summary: Grants training in Deception and a related Lore skill, along with the Charming Liar skill feat.
The character gains training in both the Computers and Infosphere Lore skills, and also acquires the Phreaker skill feat.
The character gains training in both the Performance and Media Lore skills and acquires the Impressive Performance skill feat.
The character becomes trained in Athletics and Labor Lore and gains the Hefty Hauler skill feat.
The character gains training in Survival and Mining Lore, and receives the Terrain Expertise skill feat specifically for underground terrain.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified; grants training and a feat automatically.

annotation.summary: The feature grants training in Intimidation and Underworld Lore, and provides the Intimidating Shot skill feat.
The character gains training in the Stealth skill and Underworld Lore, and also acquires the Experienced Smuggler skill feat.
The paragraph describes a character background shaped by religious upbringing, emphasizing that devotion to a deity has influenced the character’s skills and worldview, regardless of current faith.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have a background involving religious or devotional training.

annotation.summary: The character gains training in their deity's divine skill, receives the Assurance feat for that skill, and becomes trained in a Lore skill associated with their deity.
The character gains training in the Survival skill and one Lore skill tied to their past, along with the Dubious Knowledge feat.
The character gains training in the Crafting skill and a relevant Lore skill, and automatically receives the Assurance feat for that Lore skill.
The text lists two character background options—Smuggler and Teacher—likely representing distinct narrative or mechanical origins for player characters in a tabletop role-playing game.
The character gains training in Stealth and Piracy Lore, and receives the Experienced Smuggler skill feat.
The character gains training in the Society skill and a Lore skill tied to their home planet, and also acquires the Plant Rumor skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: None beyond character creation or access to the relevant background or feature.

annotation.summary: The character becomes trained in Intimidation and Piracy Lore, and gains the Group Coercion skill feat.
The character gains training in both the Piloting and Drift Lore skills and acquires the Express Driver skill feat.
The character gains training in the Survival skill and in a Lore skill related to a specific settlement, and also receives the Urban Survivalist skill feat.
The character becomes trained in either Performance or Society, gains training in Academia Lore, and acquires the Experienced Professional skill feat.
The feature grants training in Computers and Business Lore, and provides the Quick Install skill feat.
The character gains training in the Society skill and the History Lore skill, and also receives the Dubious Knowledge skill feat.
The character gains training in Athletics and Warfare Lore, and acquires the Barricade feat.
The feature grants training in the Computers and Vidgame Lore skills, and provides the Hologram Skeptic skill feat.

Characters can acquire new languages during play, typically through the Multilingual feat or other abilities. Common and uncommon languages are available through specific features, while rare or secret languages must be discovered through gameplay.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Multilingual feat or other language-granting abilities
